    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Leukodaemon (Pestilence Daemon)</h1>These skull-headed, vulture-winged daemons are harbingers of pestilence and servants of their patron Horseman, Apollyon. Manifestations of evil souls who perished from disease in life, leukodaemons work tirelessly to spread disease across all the worlds of the multiverse. More than any other daemon, leukodaemons cooperate with each other and those who conjure them to mortal worlds to spread sickness and plague, eschewing personal glory for end results.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 26<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=90">Leukodaemon</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 9</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Daemon_Leukodaemon.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Daemon_Leukodaemon.png"></a><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Daemon Trait" class="trait" title="A family of fiends spawned on the desolate plane of Abaddon, most daemons are neutral evil. They typically have darkvision and weakness to good damage."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=213">Daemon</a></span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 72</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +20; darkvision, plaguesense 60 feet<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=31"><u>Daemonic</a></u>; telepathy 100 feet<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9"><u>Medicine</a></u> +20, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +20, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=16"><u>Survival</a></u> +16<br /><b>Str</b> +6, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> +3, <b>Wis</b> +5, <b>Cha</b> +3<br /><b>Plaguesense</b> A leukodaemon senses any creature with a disease, and it knows the type and current stage of all diseases carried by any creature within range.<br /><b>Items</b> <i>+1 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=74">composite longbow</a></i> (50 arrows)<hr /><b>AC</b> 28, <b>Fort</b> +15, <b>Ref</b> +21, <b>Will</b> +19; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 155; <b>Immunities</b> death effects, disease; <b>Weaknesses</b> good 10<br /><b>Infectious Aura</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=46">disease</a>) 30 feet. Leukodaemons radiate infection. All creatures within 30 feet of a leukodaemon take a –2 status penalty to saves against disease effects. If a creature within range contracts or progresses a disease, all adjacent creatures are exposed to the same disease, at the same DC.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet, fly 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> jaws +21 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46"><u>disease</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d12+9 piercing plus 1d6 evil and daemonic pestilence</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +21 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46"><u>disease</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+9 slashing plus 1d6 evil and daemonic pestilence</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>composite longbow</i> +21 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly 1d10</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46"><u>disease</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=191"><u>propulsive</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 100 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=254"><u>reload 0</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=201"><u>volley 30 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+9 piercing plus 1d6 evil and daemonic pestilence</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 26; <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i> (x2); <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=65">detect alignment</a></u></i> (at will; good only)<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Breath Weapon</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>) The leukodaemon exhales a cloud of corpse-bloated, biting black flies in a 20-foot cone. Creatures within the cone take 4d8 piercing damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails the save becomes <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34">sickened 1</a> (or <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34">sickened 2</a> on a critical failure).</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Daemonic Pestilence</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46"><u>disease</a></u>) The leukodaemon can telepathically communicate with the afflicted creature at any distance on the same plane; <b>Saving Throw</b> DC 28 Fortitude; <b>Stage 1</b> carrier (1 day); <b>Stage 2</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10">drained 1</a> (1 day); <b>Stage 3</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10">drained 2</a> (1 day); <b>Stage 4</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10">drained 2</a> (1 day); <b>Stage 5</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=10">drained 3</a> (1 week); <b>Stage 6</b> dead</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Quicken Pestilence</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=104"><u>manipulate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) The leukodaemon coaxes a disease into full bloom. It chooses a target in its aura of pestilence that’s currently affected by a disease. That creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the disease as if the interval for the disease’s current stage had passed.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=26">Daemon</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=91">Astradaemon (Void Daemon)</a></td><td>16</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=88">Cacodaemon (Harvester Daemon)</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=89">Ceustodaemon (Guardian Daemon)</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=479">Crucidaemon (Torture Daemon)</a></td><td>15</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=90">Leukodaemon (Pestilence Daemon)</a></td><td>9</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=26">Daemon</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 70</i></a><br />Denizens of the bleak and terrible plane of Abaddon, daemons are shaped by and devoted to the destruction of life in all its forms. They seek the death of every mortal being by the most painful and horrible means possible, all in service to the apocalyptic entities known as the Four Horsemen. Each kind of daemon represents a different way to die, and their powers are nearly always aimed at spreading that particular form of death. Through the use of these powers, they seek to drag all existence down into a pit of hopelessness and despair, and to commit all souls to oblivion.<br /><br /> While those who summon daemons to the Material Plane usually seek to use the creatures’ destructive and corrupting powers for their own ends, daemons always look for ways to spread fear, doubt, and despair wherever they go. Often, daemons disguise their plots as the workings of other fiends, knowing that such confusion compounds mortals’ fear.<br /><br /> While all fiends seek to tempt mortals into lives of evil to increase their own numbers and power on their native planes, daemons are further driven by a supernatural hunger for mortal souls and use a variety of methods—not least of which is the cacodaemons’ soul gems—to entrap them. On Abaddon and in other forbidding places across the multiverse, souls are simultaneously a delicacy, a trade good, and a source of magical power, and the daemons are among the greatest gluttons, merchants, and abusers of this spiritual “resource.”<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Daemonic Divinities</h3>Numerous powerful and unique
daemon demigods, known
collectively as harbingers, rule
over swaths of Abaddon. Above
these demigods, though, are
entities of even greater power—the
four Horsemen of the Apocalypse.
As the eons go on, the names and
identities of specific horsemen
change. Currently, they consist of
Apollyon (Horseman of Pestilence),
Charon (Horseman of Death),
Szuriel (Horseman of War),
and Trelmarixian (Horseman of
Famine). Of these, only Charon has
never fallen to an upstart. Some
hold that a “Fifth Horseman” once
ruled over the other four, while
others maintain that the eternally
eclipsed sun in the skies above
Abaddon is all that remains of this
long-dead god.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Daemons</h3>As many daemons exist as there
are awful ways to die. The bloody
sangudaemon personifies death
by blood loss, while the skeletal
thanadaemon represents death
from old age. The most powerful
daemons are the olethrodaemons,
who represent the massive deaths
caused by apocalypses and the end
of entire worlds.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Soul Gems as Treasure</h3>Soul gems are traded in illicit
markets, a tradition celestials and
psychopomps alike find vile. Soul
gems’ value varies, but is generally
worth an amount relative to the
level of a gem’s captive soul.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> The Daemonic Paradox</h3>Daemons embody a fundamental
paradox—while they are
incarnations of death and seek
to devour all that lives, they are
themselves living creatures. Some
speak of a glorious end time after
which reality will finally be free
of the contagion that is life itself.
Most daemons give no thought to
this paradox.</span>

    <br />

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
